He was also the founder of the conceptual art project named "Communism" mocking Soviet propaganda style (samples of speeches of Soviet leaders, Russian patriotic songs, propaganda slogans etc. were often used in their compositions) and played with [[Siberia]]n singer-songwriter [[Yanka Dyagileva]]. Yegor Letov was also a cofounder of [[National Bolshevik Party]]. Certainly a prolific musician, Letov is a controversial figure. He was controversial in the mid-to-late 1980s when he satirized the Soviet system, and helped develop a gritty Soviet punk sound with folk underpinnings. After the fall of the USSR and especially [[1993 Russian constitutional crisis]] he disappointed in [[Yeltsin]]'s government and made friends and fans out of nationalists and communists. In later years, Letov distanced himself from any political ideology, stating (in 2004) "We're [[patriotism|patriots]], but not [[Nazism|Nazis]]. ... All the [[totalitarianism|totalitarians]] - right, left, of all colors and stripes - fuck you."<ref>[http://www.gr-oborona.ru/pub/pub/1090486302.html Official statement from Ye. Letov and Grazhdanskaya Oborona on the events in Yekaterinburg]</ref> In an interview, Letov expressed that his favorite poets were [[Alexander Vvedensky (poet)|Alexander Vvedensky]] (1904–1941), one of the [[OBERIU]] writers, and [[Vladimir Mayakovsky]]. He also expressed his interest in Conceptualism, and spoke of his own work in punk music and in creating a public image as a work of conceptual performance art. In 1997 Letov married the bass guitarist of [[Grazhdanskaya Oborona]] ''Natalya Chumakova''; they had no children. Yegor Letov died of [[heart failure]] in his sleep on 19 February 2008 at home in [[Omsk]].<ref>[http://www.russia-ic.com/news/show/5805 Cult Rock Musician Egor Letov Died], 19.02.2008</ref><ref>[http://web.archive.org/web/20101215024309/http://exile.ru/blog/detail.php?BLOG_ID=17090 Punk Legend Yegor Letov dies of heart failure] 21.02.2008 [[The eXile]]</ref> He was 43 years old. ==References== [http://www.gr-oborona.ru Official website] <references /> ==External links== * [http://www.gr-oborona.ru Official website] * [http://www.gr-oborona.info UnOfficial website] * [http://www.last.fm/music/%D0%93%D1%80%D0%B0%D0%B6%D0%B4%D0%B0%D0%BD%D1%81%D0%BA%D0%B0%D1%8F+%D0%9E%D0%B1%D0%BE%D1%80%D0%BE%D0%BD%D0%B0 Yegor Letov on Last.fm] * [http://www.ulike.net/Egor_Letov Yegor Letov on ulike.net] {{Authority control|VIAF=24516145}} {{Persondata <!-- Metadata: see [[Wikipedia:Persondata]]. --> | NAME =Letov, Egor | ALTERNATIVE NAMES = | SHORT DESCRIPTION = | DATE OF BIRTH =September 10, 1964 | PLACE OF BIRTH = [[Omsk]], [[USSR]] | DATE OF DEATH =2008-02-19 | PLACE OF DEATH = }} {{DEFAULTSORT:Letov, Egor}} [[Category:1964 births]] [[Category:2008 deaths]] [[Category:Russian punk rock musicians]] [[Category:Russian rock singers]] [[Category:People from Omsk]] [[Category:National Bolshevism]] [[Category:National Bolshevik Party politicians]]
